title: The average mark on a test written by six students was 24 marks. If no student scored less than 21 marks, what was the maximum possible score for any one student? - Quora

response.answer_text: Average for 6 is 24 points, which means that there are144 points (6 X 24) constituting the average. If 5 students make the lowest possible score of 21, that would produce 105 points ( 39 points shy of 144), meaning that the Sixth student could score 39 points to maintain the group average of 24. The answer is 39.

The maximum possible score for any one student is 39 marks. From the given information we can write an equation and solve it. Solution: Let x = the maximum possible score. The total number of marks is 24(6). Assume 5 students made the minimum score, i.e., 21. The total number of marks is equal to 5 times the minimum plus the maximum. So, 24(6) = 21(5) + x. Solving, 24(6) - 21(5) = x Therefore, x = 39
